sentence.text: Triple-negative (TN) breast cancer is an aggressive subtype of breast cancer associated with a unique negative regulation of transcription, DNA-templated of epidemiologic and genetic risk factors.

Associations with TN breast cancer were confirmed for 10 loci (positive regulation of Wnt signaling pathway, negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II, proteolysis, 2q35, 2p24.1, TERT-rs10069690, transcription by RNA polymerase II, regulation of apoptotic process, 19p13.1, cholesterol homeostasis), and we identified associations with TN breast cancer for 15 additional breast cancer loci (P AAAA 0.05: protein import into peroxisome matrix, translocation, 2q24.1, 2q31.1, spermatogenesis, positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II, negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II, 11q13.1, 11q24.3, 12p13.1, skeletal system development, regulation of transcription, DNA-templated, 12q24, mitotic cytokinesis, RAD51L1-rs2588809, MKL1).

entity.text: positive regulation of Wnt signaling pathway
negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
protein import into peroxisome matrix, translocation
positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Further, two SNPs independent of previously reported signals in transcription by RNA polymerase II [rs12525163 odds ratio (OR) = 1.15, P = 4.9 × 10(-) (4)] and 19p13.1 (rs1864112 OR = 0.84, P = 1.8 × 10(-) (9)) were associated with TN breast cancer.
